verses.verse: And it came to pass,<WH1961> when David<WH1732> and his men<WH376> were come<WH935> to Ziklag<WH6860> on the third<WH7992> day,<WH3117> that the Amalekites<WH6003> had invaded<WH6584> <WH413> the south,<WH5045> and Ziklag,<WH6860> and smitten<WH5221> <WH853> Ziklag,<WH6860> and burned<WH8313> it with fire;<WH784>

And David<WH1732> inquired<WH7592> at the LORD,<WH3068> saying,<WH559> Shall I pursue<WH7291> after<WH310> this<WH2088> troop?<WH1416> shall I overtake<WH5381> them? And he answered<WH559> him, Pursue:<WH7291> for<WH3588> thou shalt surely overtake<WH5381> <WH5381> them, and without fail recover<WH5337> <WH5337> all.

So David<WH1732> went,<WH1980> he<WH1931> and the six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> men<WH376> that<WH834> were with<WH854> him, and came<WH935> to<WH5704> the brook<WH5158> Besor,<WH1308> where those that were left behind<WH3498> stayed.<WH5975>

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> unto him, To whom<WH4310> belongest thou?<WH859> and whence<WH335> <WH4480> <WH2088> art thou?<WH859> And he said,<WH559> I<WH595> am a young man<WH5288> of Egypt,<WH4713> servant<WH5650> to an Amalekite;<WH376> <WH6003> and my master<WH113> left<WH5800> me, because<WH3588> three<WH7969> days<WH3117> ago I fell sick.<WH2470>

And when he had brought him down,<WH3381> behold,<WH2009> they were spread abroad<WH5203> upon<WH5921> <WH6440> all<WH3605> the earth,<WH776> eating<WH398> and drinking,<WH8354> and dancing,<WH2287> because of all<WH3605> the great<WH1419> spoil<WH7998> that<WH834> they had taken<WH3947> out of the land<WH4480> <WH776> of the Philistines,<WH6430> and out of the land<WH4480> <WH776> of Judah.<WH3063>

And David<WH1732> smote<WH5221> them from the twilight<WH4480> <WH5399> even unto<WH5704> the evening<WH6153> of the next day:<WH4283> and there escaped<WH4422> not<WH3808> a man<WH376> of them, save<WH3588> <WH518> four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> young<WH5288> men,<WH376> which<WH834> rode<WH7392> upon<WH5921> camels,<WH1581> and fled.<WH5127>
And David<WH1732> recovered<WH5337> <WH853> all<WH3605> that<WH834> the Amalekites<WH6002> had carried away:<WH3947> and David<WH1732> rescued<WH5337> his two<WH8147> wives.<WH802>

And there was nothing<WH3808> lacking<WH5737> to them, neither<WH4480> small<WH6996> nor<WH5704> great,<WH1419> neither<WH5704> sons<WH1121> nor daughters,<WH1323> neither spoil,<WH4480> <WH7998> nor<WH5704> any<WH3605> thing that<WH834> they had taken<WH3947> to them: David<WH1732> recovered<WH7725> all.<WH3605>

And David<WH1732> took<WH3947> <WH853> all<WH3605> the flocks<WH6629> and the herds,<WH1241> which they drove<WH5090> before<WH6440> those<WH1931> other cattle,<WH4735> and said,<WH559> This<WH2088> is David's<WH1732> spoil.<WH7998>

And David<WH1732> came<WH935> to<WH413> the two hundred<WH3967> men,<WH376> which<WH834> were so faint<WH6296> that they could not follow<WH1980> <WH310> David,<WH1732> whom they had made also to abide<WH3427> at the brook<WH5158> Besor:<WH1308> and they went forth<WH3318> to meet<WH7125> David,<WH1732> and to meet<WH7125> the people<WH5971> that<WH834> were with<WH854> him: and when David<WH1732> came near<WH5066> to<WH853> the people,<WH5971> he saluted<WH7592> <WH7965> them.

Then answered<WH6030> all<WH3605> the wicked<WH7451> men<WH376> and men of Belial,<WH1100> of those<WH4480> <WH376> that<WH834> went<WH1980> with<WH5973> David,<WH1732> and said,<WH559> Because<WH3282> <WH834> they went<WH1980> not<WH3808> with<WH5973> us, we will not<WH3808> give<WH5414> them aught of the spoil<WH4480> <WH7998> that<WH834> we have recovered,<WH5337> save<WH3588> <WH518> to every man<WH376> <WH853> his wife<WH802> and his children,<WH1121> that they may lead them away,<WH5090> and depart.<WH1980>

Then said<WH559> David,<WH1732> Ye shall not<WH3808> do<WH6213> so,<WH3651> my brethren,<WH251> with<WH854> that which<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> hath given<WH5414> us, who hath preserved<WH8104> us, and delivered<WH5414> <WH853> the company<WH1416> that came<WH935> against<WH5921> us into our hand.<WH3027>

For who<WH4310> will hearken<WH8085> unto you in this<WH2088> matter?<WH1697> but<WH3588> as his part<WH2506> is that goeth down<WH3381> to the battle,<WH4421> so shall his part<WH2506> be that tarrieth<WH3427> by<WH5921> the stuff:<WH3627> they shall part<WH2505> alike.<WH3162>

And it was<WH1961> so from that day<WH4480> <WH3117> <WH1931> forward,<WH4605> that he made<WH7760> it a statute<WH2706> and an ordinance<WH4941> for Israel<WH3478> unto<WH5704> this<WH2088> day.<WH3117>
